   jemalloc 5.2.0 requires Autoconf 2.68 but CentOS 6 ships Autoconf 2.63.

kou commented on issue #4626: ARROW-5663: [Packaging][RPM] Drop support for CentOS 6 and update for CentOS 7
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4626#issuecomment-504185172
 
 
   I think that we should avoid updating Autoconf because it's hard to maintain.
   
   Here are our options to support CentOS 6:
   
   1. Use release jemalloc tarball instead of snapshot tarball. Release tarball includes `configure`. So we don't need Autoconf.
   2. Don't use jemalloc by `ARROW_JEMALLOC=OFF`.
   
   This is a patch for 1:
   
   ```diff
   diff --git a/cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake b/cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
   index fb2ba7b3..1d3895cb 100644
   --- a/cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
   +++ b/cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
   @@ -320,7 +320,7 @@ if(DEFINED ENV{ARROW_JEMALLOC_URL})
      set(JEMALLOC_SOURCE_URL "$ENV{ARROW_JEMALLOC_URL}")
    else()
      set(JEMALLOC_SOURCE_URL
   -      "https://github.com/jemalloc/jemalloc/archive/${JEMALLOC_VERSION}.tar.gz")
   +      "https://github.com/jemalloc/jemalloc/releases/download/${JEMALLOC_VERSION}/jemalloc-${JEMALLOC_VERSION}.tar.bz2")
    endif()
    
    if(DEFINED ENV{ARROW_LZ4_URL})
   @@ -1353,7 +1353,7 @@ if(ARROW_JEMALLOC)
        jemalloc_ep
        URL ${JEMALLOC_SOURCE_URL}
        PATCH_COMMAND touch doc/jemalloc.3 doc/jemalloc.html
   -    CONFIGURE_COMMAND ./autogen.sh
   +    CONFIGURE_COMMAND ./configure
                          "AR=${CMAKE_AR}"
                          "CC=${CMAKE_C_COMPILER}"
                          "--prefix=${JEMALLOC_PREFIX}"
   ```
   
   I think that 1 is better than 2. Because we don't need Autoconf on other platforms such as macOS.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
